Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: pmset

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Settings for all

Arguments.Name: setting
Arguments.Description: setting

Arguments.Name: displaysleep
Arguments.Description: Display sleep timer (value in minutes, or 0 to disable)

Arguments.Name: disksleep
Arguments.Description: Disk spindown timer (value in minutes, or 0 to disable)

Arguments.Name: sleep
Arguments.Description: System sleep timer (value in minutes, or 0 to disable)

Arguments.Name: womp
Arguments.Description: Wake on ethernet magic packet (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: ring
Arguments.Description: Wake on modem ring (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: autorestart
Arguments.Description: Automatic restart on power loss (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: dps
Arguments.Description: Dynamically change processor speed based on load (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: reduce
Arguments.Description: Reduce processor speed (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: powerbutton
Arguments.Description: Sleep the machine when power button is pressed (value=0/1)

Arguments.Name: lidwake
Arguments.Description: Wake the machine when the laptop lid (or clamshell) is opened (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: acwake
Arguments.Description: Wake the machine when power source (AC/battery) is changed (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: lessbright
Arguments.Description: Slightly turn down display brightness when switching to this power source (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: halfdim
Arguments.Description: Display sleep will use an intermediate half-brightness state between full brightness and fully off  (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: sms
Arguments.Description: Use Sudden Motion Sensor to park disk heads on sudden changes in G force (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: hibernatemode
Arguments.Description: Change hibernation mode. 0 = normal sleep, 1 = hibernate mode, 3 = safe sleep, 25 = hibernate mode for post-2005 portable Macs

Arguments.Name: hibernatefile
Arguments.Description: Change hibernation image file location. (value = path)

Arguments.Name: ttyskeepawake
Arguments.Description: Prevent idle system sleep when any tty (e.g. remote login session) is 'active'. (value = 0/1)

Arguments.Name: networkoversleep
Arguments.Description: This setting affects how macOS networking presents shared network services during system sleep

Arguments.Name: destroyfvkeyonstandby
Arguments.Description: Destroy File Vault Key when going to standby mode. (value: 1 - Destroy, 0 - Retain)

Arguments.Description: value

Arguments.Name: value
Arguments.Description: value

Arguments.Name: -g
Arguments.Description: GETTING

Arguments.Name: live
Arguments.Description: Display the settings currently in use. (default if no argument given)

Arguments.Name: custom
Arguments.Description: Display custom settings for all power sources

Arguments.Name: cap
Arguments.Description: Display which power management features the machine supports

Arguments.Name: sched
Arguments.Description: Display scheduled startup/wake and shutdown/sleep events

Arguments.Name: ups
Arguments.Description: Display UPS emergency thresholds

Arguments.Name: ps
Arguments.Description: Display status of batteries and UPSs

Arguments.Name: pslog
Arguments.Description: Display an ongoing log of power source (battery and UPS)state

Arguments.Name: rawlog
Arguments.Description: Display an ongoing log of battery state as read directly from battery

Arguments.Name: profiles
Arguments.Description: Display the settings associated with each Energy Saver profile. 10.5+

Arguments.Name: thermlog
Arguments.Description: Show a log of thermal notifications that affect CPU speed. Not available on all platforms

Arguments.Name: assertions
Arguments.Description: Display a summary of power assertions. 10.6+

Arguments.Name: assertionslog
Arguments.Description: Show a log of assertion creations and releases. 10.6+

Arguments.Name: activity
Arguments.Description: Display a summary of power state of Display wrangler and Disk Queue Manager.10.6+

Arguments.Name: activitylog
Arguments.Description: Show a log of power state changes to Display Wrangler and Disk Queue Manager. 10.6+

Arguments.Name: sysload
Arguments.Description: Display the "system load advisory" 10.6+

Arguments.Name: sysloadlog
Arguments.Description: Display an ongoing log of lives changes to the system load advisory. 10.6+

Arguments.Name: ac
Arguments.Description: Display details about an attached AC power adapter

Arguments.Name: log
Arguments.Description: Display a history of sleeps, wakes, and other power management events

Arguments.Name: uuid
Arguments.Description: Display the currently active sleep/wake UUID

Arguments.Name: uuidlog
Arguments.Description: Display the currently active sleep/wake UUID, and prints a new UUID as they're set by the system

Arguments.Name: history
Arguments.Description: A debugging tool. Prints a timeline of system sleeplwake UUIDs

Arguments.Name: historydetailed
Arguments.Description: Prints driver-level timings for a sleep/wake. Pass a UUID as an argument

Arguments.Name: everything
Arguments.Description: Print output from every argument under the GETTING header 10.8+

Arguments.Name: UUID
Arguments.Description: UUID

Arguments.Name: schedule
Arguments.Description: For setting up one-time power events
